intro: Acamptoclados, commonly known as the false lily of the valley, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of South America. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a reddish or purple underside. Its flowers are typically clustered in racemes, with bell-shaped corollas that are usually pink or white. Acamptoclados is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and delicate floral display.
